alert.note: Alert for Dundy; Hitchcock; Red Willow (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 14 at 7:35PM CST until February 16 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ WEDNESDAY TO 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow. Total snow accumulations ranging from 4 to 7 inches. NNE winds at 20 to 30 mph. * WHERE...In Colorado, Yuma County. In Nebraska, Dundy, Hitchcock and Red Willow Counties. In Kansas, Cheyenne, Rawlins, Decatur, and Norton counties. * WHEN...From 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ Wednesday to 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ Thursday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous travel conditions associated with heavy snow and blowing and drifting snow, especially during the day on Wednesday. Road closures are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will overspread the region from southwest to northeast between sunrise and noon on Wednesday. Areas situated along and south of Interstate 70 in eastern Colorado (such as Burlington and Cheyenne Wells) will see snow develop around or shortly before sunrise. Areas situated further to the north and east (such as Hill City, Kansas and McCook, Nebraska) will see snow develop several hours after sunrise, during the mid to late morning. The heaviest snow, and worst overall conditions, are expected to occur late Wednesday morning and Wednesday afternoon. Snow will end from west to east late Wednesday evening and Wednesday night. Wind chill readings as low as 5 to 15 degrees below zero are expected Thursday morning.
info.instruction: Consider alternate travel plans. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
